page.title: 01Central Hartlepool Today
page.content: The centre of Hartlepool has large areas of dereliction where once the main hub of the town stood. It is still the area regarded as the centre of Hartlepool. The railway station, only bus station and a lot of the towns administrative buildings can still be found here. The dock area which once spawned thriving ship building, heavy manufacturing, and fishing industries, now bears the scars of those prosperous times. In their place are car and pulp import, and scrap export terminals. What was once the 'Coal Dock' now plays host to the rebuilding of H.M.S. Warrior. However, slowly the centre of the town is being rebuilt and a Hartlepool with a new and modern face is emerging. Hopefully it is a face with the smile of prosperity.
